text: Virginia Fox (April 2, 1902 – October 14, 1982) was an American actress who starred in many silent movie of the 1910s and 1920s, her career spanned 14 years. Fox was born in Wheeling, West Virginia to Marie (née Oglseby) and Frederick Fox. She was married to Darryl F. Zanuck from 1924 until they separated in 1956. They had three children, one of them was movie producer Richard D. Zanuck. Fox died on October 14, 1982 in Palm Springs, California from emphysema and from cerebral thrombosis, she was 80 years old. ==Movies== Year Film Role Notes 1915 A Submarine Pirate 1920 Neighbors The Girl 1921 The Haunted House Bank President's Daughter 1921 Hard Luck Virginia 1921 The Goat Chief's daughter 1921 The Playhouse Twin Uncredited 1922 The Paleface Indian Maiden Uncredited 1922 Cops Mayor's Daughter 1922 The Blacksmith Horsewoman 1922 The Electric House Girl Uncredited 1923 The Love Nest The Girl 1926 The Caveman Party Girl ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1902 births Category:1982 deaths Category:Deaths from cerebral thrombosis Category:Actors from West Virginia Category:American silent movie actors Category:Deaths from emphysema Category:People from Wheeling, West Virginia
title: Virginia Fox
